price.review: Seems like a great product for the price, especially if they stand by their product and replace the defect one.
I also found lower prices online and surprisingly not on amazon.
For my intended use, this is an excellent low cost solution.
Original review: I ordered the 2-pack of Wyze Cam v2 for about $50.
Sadly, it seems you get what you pay for.
Complete waste or money.
For the price and value you can't go wrong with this product.
I'm very upset with this purchase.
They are great cameras, but don't even have the same features as the Wyze cameras and cost $75 more!
For $25, you'd think these would be cheap cameras with a crappy app for the phone that never works.
If i would review this as a 100 dollar device it would just be good.
I'm located in Poland, but when if you add intercontinental shipping and import taxes these little gems are still way cheaper than the competition.
Also the cameras are only $19 on the WYZE.Com website vs Amazon $25.
My existing/old wifi camera system cost me $800 for 6 cameras and at $25-30 a piece for these cameras, you CAN'T beat it.
You get what you pay for.
Sure this comes with free 14 day cloud storage, but where is that video feed going to?
You can save hundreds of dollars by going with Wyze!
You cant really complain if you are paying under $50 for what you get here.
If you want a camera that will have privacy then you need to spend more money.
Pros: -Extremely affordable price point for a security camera that comes with a well-made app.
"You get what you pay for".
Yes, it has falls short in certain areas but for me, the low price compensates for it.
for 25$ aint bad, just wish it was a bit long on the motion detection capture.
only reason i am giving this a 5 star is because of the price.
- you need to purchase microSD card to write the recordings!
My goal is to provide a review NOT based or price but on the product in general.
But im sure that the companys goals is to someday provide us consumers a more affordable home security/monitor solution.
I agree it is NOT a fair comparison due to its price.
$20 a pop is just nuts.
$20 to leave a negative review against a competitor is darn cheap.
The cheaper cameras I looked where just that cheap with poor video quality.
I've have been looking for security camera's for a long time and looked at lot of different brands, but the price of other systems for good quality video was price prohibitive.
I got these for $20, and if amazon has them listed for more, go to the manufacturer website to buy them.

These little cameras are so inexpensive I got a couple to see how helpful they would be to provide video recording when we are not in the house.
Yes the only negative that I found is after downloading the Wyze app you can buy these cameras and their  assessories cheaper directly, than you can here on Amazon!
These cameras are $20 from the Wyze app...... the Pan cam is $30 on the app.
Which are reviews by people who like to complain about finding a $100 bill on the ground.
I bought 2 to try out after being somewhat  skeptical from reading the reviews here.
But are a 10th of the cost!
For the price ($25) buy one and give it a try.
- Price is really low for the camera and 14 days recording.
I hate exposed wires, but I guess I will deal with them for the low cost.
The app costs $3.99.
They are great in all functional aspects and perhaps most importantly, price.
What an awesome product for such a low low price!
Great price for this product.
Bought two.
Buyer beware!
Dont waste your time and money with this cheap crap.
We attempted to use them as cheap baby monitors but they would just not respond all night.
I hated that it didnt record for long unless you paid for the service and also that it wasnt wireless.
The Arlo I installed in my moms home it records for a week is wireless and rechargeable, but comes with a hefty price tag of $600 for 3 camera set up.
Not really complaining,,,,, for the price these camera hold their own against the bigger players.
For less than $300 I built a 10 camera security station that I can toggle from camera to camera and constantly monitor the perimeter of my property.
I got the 2 pack.

durable.review: It took a little training, but she now responds to commands when I am not even home!
I have one installed outdoors protected from the weather with no issues.
I Purchased 7, So far all of the cams purchased work with no issues.
I have used the most reliable camera in two different houses with different routers, cable providers, etc with no difference in performance.
Told them again.
My favorite part is that even when you unplug them to put it in a different outlet they reconnect to the WiFi automatically!
We even used it last night as a baby monitor for our grandchildren and it worked perfectly.
one that will actually work out the box.
Notably - the camera is well built for made in china.
Also, when not in use it wont turn off.
Of course they arrived within a few days (feeding my excitement) and I was stunned.

This one does not move but basically has the same qualities.
I have not used it for two way communication yet and probably don't need to.
I install life safety and security devices for a living.
my constructive criticism will only help them to develop a much better product in the near future.
I personally think the company is on the right direction and have come from almost nowhere.
- it is NOT WIRELESS!
Saw that this product and its company are gaining ground and  wanted to see what the hype is all about.
First, the device is beautiful - from the unboxing to the range of motion, sturdiness of the build, and the magnetic disc you can opt to use to hang it.
I've had no problem with security, I have a very strong password on my account and if anyone is getting to my cameras directly through the servers - I've never seen a hint of it.
I was told by Wyze that the firmware problem  was fixed and the timer workaround is no longer necessary.
We would make the same choice again.

I have not used the adhesive and mounting hardware as I intend to move them somewhere else later, so I do have to go readjust them occasionally when a cat decides they want them pointed somewhere else, but otherwise they stay put without the mounting and seem to be very stable.
Besides proven durability, the only major thing that Arlo has over the Wyze is outdoor use and 100% completely wireless operation, although the Arlo batteries are a bit of a hassle and expensive.
Construction looks and feels solid, however the Arlos win on construction as they are weather proof and they have survived several years of outdoor use for me.
The software/firmware stability is so-far flawless and surpasses my experience with several painful Arlo updates and software flaws in the early days.
The app works well on my iPhone with no issues.
And besides that I dont have any that would be showing some kind of privacy problems where I need to even worry if they are turning on by themselves or being watched by somebody else.
But the reviews here are like most reviews that I read.
You can read for yourself in the product description.
Enabled the skill.
I nave my two cameras pointed outside and rhey work fine.
I put them in before set up and had no issues.
One works fine with seemingly no issues.
However, they are working for what I needed them to work for.
However, since I was able to connect 2 cameras, these are working out just fine.
There are no settings to change it.
I started with one, now have several.
That being said I have one of these outside under the protection of the front porch and after a few weeks it is still running fine.
The 3m tape to attach the metal plate to the wall or ceiling works and holds very well.
Whether I could turn off the system or not.
The wizeapp still works fine during this issue.
Less delay and more dependable.
I started life with 2 of these.

We also have these tied in to our echo show 2.
No regrets
I will be keeping all three and here is why.
There is no problem with these cameras they work great.
I have these all over my home, because we have home health staff for a disabled family member.
It's not a router problem because my existing ones are working fine.
Two even run on a phone hot spot with no issues (only send on movement to save on data usage).
Have several cameras and all work as expected.

easy.review: This is the easiest camera I have ever set up, literally took less than 3 minutes.
Setup was really simple (a couple minutes of work), and the app is equally easy to work with.
I settled upon these; cheap, at $25 a unit, and super easy to set up.
The task of connecting and configuring them is very easy without any problems, the phone app is very sufficient and the image quality is wonderful.
The instructions were so easy to do, I am not very electronic illiterate but I did ALL 4 by myself within about 7 minutes.
Setup was a breeze once you download the app and I had no problems connecting to the device.

A key tip for getting the tip-top maximum utility and value from your Wyse Labs device is to add a microSD card to the camera.
Here's why: the camera's event detection features, when triggered, will record and store to the cloud 12-second clips, which isn't very much time at all.
The camera will also not re-trigger on subsequent motion events for several minutes after the initial trigger.
Adding the microSD card (it can be any card up to 32GB), enables the device to record continuously in a loop, overwriting the oldest images when storage gets full.
The cloud-stored 12-second clip may or may not show anything useful for your application.
As a user of Ring outdoor cameras, I was initially kind of put off by the 12-second clip length limitations, but I didn't understand at first the utility of the onboard SD card storage.
Trust me: you want to get a microSD card for your Wyse Cameras!

cam.review: I have 3 of these (kids bedrooms and play room) and a pan cam for our main living area.
I have  started to use my iPad to have my daughters room live and the boys room on my phone at night but that is really silly and seems they should fix this in an update!
;) Anyway, minus the potential for hacking, if you need a cheap options, these cams do their job and do it well.
I did take the time to rip out the microphone, though.
I  receive notification on my phone when the cam "notices" any motion and when I open the line, I am able to listen to what is going on and able to say something that is audible throug the cam.
The cam is accessible through Amazon Alexa and I tried it through an Amazon Fire 7" tablet, when you ask Alexa to show you the cam name, it displays what the cam is "seeing" instantly on the screen.
I setup one in my garage as I constantly ask myself when I leave my house if I closed the garage or not.
Events can be sound, or motion.
But so far Im using a regular baby monitor for night, and this for naps.
Wanted to use this as a baby monitor.
I have a second one I use for a toddler cam and its fine since I dont need constant sound.
Haha..
Currently I have a wyze came next to a nest cam.
The nest cam picks up everything, it can tell me if it saw a person, heard a dog etc... the wyze cam detects about 20% of what the nest cam detects.
when you speak on your phone to the cam, you can actually hear yourself from the delay!
-when using live stream, there is a very loud annoying sound on the background and im not sure if this is speaker feedback but tried to distance speakers as far as their provided wire can stretch!
You NEED to plug this to a power source (wall plug, power bank, UPS etc) in order for the Wyze cam to work and function!.
On a monthly basis we see one giant company after the next get hacked..
It was like someone turning the lights on and off in our room.
My workaround (as soon as I was able to get to the remote location ) was to plug them into a timer  that turns them off and on again every night so they reset.
When she came back, I used the mic (I wasn't at home) to say something to her and ended up scaring her and she thought it was one of the little kids toys under the couch or something.
This isn't a function I was particularly drawn to, so I'm not terribly concerned with it.
I was able to communicate with her and comfort her through the camera until my wife made it home.
Also the app for my wired system only allowed me to access the live stream and to turn on or off the notifications.
Then, I opened up my Alexa app and searched Wyze.
I opened up one and downloaded the Wyze app, then made an account.
But with a Best Buy sales associate right there, I kept my mouth shut.
And vice versa with me talking through the cam.
So I set it up in my bedroom, facing the driveway & street.
And 2 minutes before a car drives by.
The app is made for a phone, so when you first view it via an ipad, its in vertical mode with is a bit annoying.
I have one on top of each cage looking down.
Now when they stroll down to the end they are on camera and it has encouraged them all to get a bag pick up the crap.
I spent way too much time working on this, returning and I'll make do with the ones I have.
Plan to put all on hot spot with movement only recording.

UPDATE: I contacted support.
I told them what was wrong with lots of details.
They basically ignored the details and asked for everything all over again.
Sent more info during some back-and-forth.
Finally they said they'd put me in touch with their team for a replacement.
And then... nothing.
Haven't heard from them since.
Both have connection problems."
Haven't gotten a replacement.
So basically their customer service is on par with their product:  Cheap, shoddy and broken.
I'm going to return the product to Amazon and leave up this 1-star review so people will know what they're getting into.
They completely dropped the ball.

surveillance.review: My complaint is that I cannot view all my cameras live on one screen.
I have to open each individually then close and open the next to check on the kids...etc.
This little camera is awesome for an inexpensive in-home security or to check on your pet.
I use them in various places around my house to be able to keep an eye on things, mostly my kids and dogs.
I wanted to put a couple cameras around the house mainly to monitor my pets.
I have motion detection on a schedule for one of the cams, and the notifications work as you'd expect.
I only use a couple to monitor the front and back entrances to my home.

As I am normally hundreds of miles from the house that we are monitoring, the unplug/replug power reboot suggested by Wyze is not an option for people using them to monitor cabins, second homes, or primary homes when away for extended periods.
You can check your home for any activity over the Internet even while at work.
I purchased two of these cameras to overlook the property.
Until then, I have to have true outdoor cameras.
If they do, the only picture they are going to see is a picture of my garage, so I don't really care if they want to spend the whole day watching that.
I bought several Wyze cameras about two weeks ago.
You can set up motion detection, alerts, integrate with Alexa or anything else through IFTTT.
When it comes to the use of keeping an eye of things i can add that after 3 days of having Wyze cams it clearly showed that out our nanny is far more interested in her phone than in my daughter.
I bought these for my parents house so they could watch the front and back doors.
When I ordered the cameras, I had installed the Wyse app on my iPhone.
My use application is to monitor a couple of storage areas.
Security cameras are important to view away from home!
I work quite a distance from home and am able to keep an eye on things from my office or anywhere in the world I happen to be as long as I have wifi.
I do have a microSD card in mine so that I could go back 24 hours if something happened, but mostly I just wanted these to spy on my dogs.
I don't use the motion notifications, but do have the sound notifications turned on and it's a nice feature so I can snoop on them if they're barking up a storm at something.
I heard about Wyze cameras through some forums.
Spy cam bonus: add a battery pack and with Wifi you can record from any location.
So what if they record me?
I beleive many people are looking for an affordable solution to Arlo/Nest cams.
I have 5 cameras so far, and plan to add another 8 over the next year assuming they continue to work.
We bought these cameras to be able to keep an eye on our Mom.
I didn't actually realize it did this, I was bored one night and told my daughter to go grab something outside, I wanted to see if she would trip the sensor coming from the house.
I bought the 2-pieces package and I use the two Wyze cameras to check what is happening surrounding my home.
I have a wired security camera system for my primary residence and was looking for something for my summer place at the lake.
But it allows you to monitor the cameras in multimode, and also on your desktop.
There was some people looking at the security camera products.
Walking back to that section I walked through the Home Security / camera area.
I am hoping the second camera will be easier to install, but first I have to figure out if there is a power source outside my front door.
Can watch front and back of house whenever I want to from behind a window.
My only complaint is that Wyze hadnt yet mastered the ability to monitor more than one location with the app.
Id like to put these cameras at a second property as well as take one with me on the road.

I enjoy the convenience of set-up, the flexibility of moving them when I want different surveillance in different areas of the property and the peace of mind of being able to check in on my property at will.
It records to somewhere in China!
Edit 4/8/19 So after my original review, and buying an actual baby monitor, I decided to give these a second shot as their supposed intended use as a security camera.
I installed a set of baxia solar powered lights and for under $200 I have a home security system with 4 cameras, recording capability and excellent image quality.
I'm monitoring the mama cats I am fostering for a local rescue.
Well I solved that problem I put up several cameras in every window.
And even when Im out of town Im still monitor them.
I sold my house a few years ago and I had an expensive camera system for the property.
I set up two Wyze Cameras to address that.
Mom feels safer knowing that I'm watching over her with these cameras.
Will definitely be purchasing our secondary cameras soon!

review_types.best_review: I had originally reviewed this camera a couple of months ago with 5 stars, but given the recent & repeated problems connecting to one of my cameras and issues with Wyze Cam 'servers' I am dropping to 4 stars.  Maybe Wyze has been cranking out so many new products lately, that they can not keep up with the support of infrastructure and/or existing hardware.  Whatever it is, reliability needs to improve.  My original review follows... I bought 2 of the Wyze Cams in February 2019 to supplement my 4 Arlo cameras that I have owned for several years.  Here are some of the things that I like about the Wyze Cam First the price, which is wow this is a fantastic camera for $25!  To add just 1 Arlo to my existing 4 cameras would set me back $150, or the same price as 6 Wyze Cams.  The packaging is well done and minimalistic.  Setting up the camera was 4 easy steps that took about 5 minutes, very simple.  The camera articulates nicely on its base so that I can mount the base, which is also magnetic, and get the camera pointing in the desired direction.  The app works well on my iPhone with no issues.  The wifi range seems adequate and compares well to the Arlo.  You can shut off the IR light through the software, which helps when looking out a window at night to eliminate reflection.  Motion detection and notification seems to work better than my Arlo cameras.  My Arlos frequently trigger recording after an object has moved past the frame, completely missing the action, and I have yet to see the Wyze Cam do the same.  Picture quality is excellent and with a SD card they store several days of continuous video.  The software/firmware stability is so-far flawless and surpasses my experience with several painful Arlo updates and software flaws in the early days.  Construction looks and feels solid, however the Arlos win on construction as they are weather proof and they have survived several years of outdoor use for me. Here are some things that would improve the Wyze Cam. First and foremost I would like to see an application for my iMac that would allow me to see my cameras in the same way that I can see them with the iPhone app.  Actually, a web based app would allow access anywhere, but raises some security concerns. A more revealing and complete explanation of some of the features of this camera would be appreciated.  Wyze has a q&a section on their web page that does a pretty good job, but not everything is covered there.  One question that I have not found an answer too is what, how, and where the images are stored.  Its not immediately clear what gets stored on the SD card and what goes to the internet.  Although internet connectivity and storage is a concern, I also believe internet storage is a benefit, because a burglar could steal the camera and you will still have the video of the theft when stored remotely.  Arlos store everything remotely as well, but provide a bit more control over remote storage. The power cord is bulky for such a tiny camera.  I will be looking for different power supply options including battery and solar.  Also a USB Light Bulb LampCharger like the one by NYCE Power also might come in handy for powering this camera. An outdoor version of this camera would be nice.  I may try a DIY project to make it weather resistant as others have, because at $25 a camera why not?  The Reolink Argus Pro w/ solar is another good out of the box option, but at a higher price. Improve the playback and editing of continuous video by adding a fast forward, video cutting and storage transfer.  The software slider works well, but better tools for playback are needed. New buyers, maker sure you purchase a fast 16 or 32 gb SD card with this camera. Besides proven durability, the only major thing that Arlo has over the Wyze is outdoor use and 100% completely wireless operation, although the Arlo batteries are a bit of a hassle and expensive.  I could buy a couple of Wyze Cams for what I pay in batteries for my Arlos each year.  The bottom line is that the Wyze Cam an incredibly good investment.
review_types.worst_review: These cameras are nearly useless even as a basic remote security camera; it is not nearly reliable enough to be to the foundation of a home security monitoring system. Picture quality is good enough (but not great), as is the night vision. The primary issue I have is with the fickle responsiveness. I dont know if its a problem with the app, hardware, or both, but more often than not, I will see at least one of the cameras as being offline and unreachable. It will magically reconnect whenever it feels like it. If I hear activity that I want to check on, more often than not the camera will be offline, or will just refuse to connect. Changing camera settings in the app is equally unreliable, where it takes uncomfortably long for the individual camera settings to load, if they load at all. It makes it difficult to determine if youve actually configured the camera and whether the settings have stuck or not. Reviewing video is equally hit-or-miss; some captured motion event videos will appear but are unviewable, with a vague message saying the the video doesnt exist. Why is it visible in the events list, then? Also, the motion detection regularly fails to trigger whenever there is movement that should trigger it (probably due to a camera being sporadically offline). The cameras cannot be relied upon to capture everything that happens in front of it. I dont know if I missed something in the settings, but there seems to be no way to adjust the recording time after motion or sound detection, it appears to be fixed at 12 seconds. UPDATE: I discovered that you have to pay extra for a subscription to get that perk. These cameras are adequate if youre on a budget and you absolutely need something, but be aware that they will eventually fail you when you need them. You get what you pay for.
review_types.neutral: Compre dos de estas, una esta funcionado perfectamente pero la segunda parece estar daada/rota ya que luego de configurarla solo me sale esa imagen azul en el live stream. Segn las opiniones del foro de soporte tiene un sensor roto. Quiero un reembolso o el envo de una cmara nueva.
